snippet: Individuals buying health insurance on their own will see their premiums tumble next year in New York State, and supporters of the health care overhaul credit the online purchasing exchanges the law created.
abstract: State officials say New Yorkers buying health insurance on their own will see their premiums tumble in 2014 as changes under the federal health care law take effect; supporters of Affordable Care Act credit drop in rates to the online purchasing exchanges the law created, which they say are spurring competition among insurers who are anticipating an influx of new customers.

byline.original: By RONI CARYN RABIN and REED ABELSON

lead_paragraph: Individuals buying health insurance on their own will see their premiums tumble next year in New York State, and supporters of the health care overhaul credit the online purchasing exchanges the law created.

headline.main: Health Plan Cost for New Yorkers Set to Fall 50%
headline.print_headline: Health Plan Cost For New Yorkers Set to Fall 50%

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
